formalpara.title: Figure 1. Omic approaches to generate gradually improving models of the complete set of biologically relevant interactions.
formalpara.para: Genome- and proteome-scale studies have provided information on the topology, function and dynamics of C. elegans macromolecular networks. Expression profiling (transcriptome), DNA-protein, RNA-protein, and protein-protein interactions (interactome), phenotypic analyses (phenome), and protein localization (localizome) can be integrated, allowing the dynamic properties of the resulting network to be related to C. elegans biology. Adapted from Walhout et al. (1998) and Vidal (2001).
